section.title: Overview
section.para: The specification for JSON-RPC is available at: http://www.jsonrpc.org/specification.
The JSONRPC-S module uses the xHTTP module to handle HTTP/S requests. Read the documentation of the xHTTP module for more details.

listitem.para: This module does not implement asynchronous RPC commands. It is unlikely that asynchronous RPC commands will be executed from an JSON-RPC over HTTP client.
This module does not accept parameters embedded in a structure (see the RPC documentation for more info about how parameters can be passed to RPC).

section.title: &kamailio; Modules
section.para:
The following modules must be loaded before this module:
xhttp - xHTTP (optional, required when http transport is wanted).

section.title: External Libraries or Applications
section.para:
The following libraries or applications must be installed before running &kamailio; with this module loaded:
None

section.title: pretty_format (int)
section.para: Pretty format for JSON-RPC response document.

section.title: transport (int)
section.para: Control what transports are enabled. The value can be:

listitem.para: 0 - all transports that can be enabled. For http, the xhttp module must be loaded. For FIFO, the fifo_name parameter must be set. For DATAGRAM, the dgram_socket parameter must be set.

section.para: The value can be also a combination of specific transports. Make the sum of the desired transports to enable them. For example, enabling FIFO and DATAGRAM can be done setting transport=6.

para.emphasis: Default value is '6' (fifo and datagram transport).

section.title: fifo_name (str)
section.para: The name of the FIFO file to be created for listening and reading external commands. If the given path is not absolute, the fifo file is created relative to run_dir (global parameter).

section.title: fifo_mode (int)
section.para: Permission to be used for creating the listening FIFO file. It follows the UNIX conventions.

section.title: fifo_group (int or str)
section.para: System Group to be used for creating the listening FIFO file.

para.emphasis: Default value is the inherited one (process group).

section.title: fifo_user (int or str)
section.para: System User to be used for creating the listening FIFO file.

para.emphasis: Default value is the inherited one (process user).

section.title: fifo_reply_dir (str)
section.para: Directory to be used for creating the reply FIFO files.

section.title: dgram_socket (str)
section.para: The name of a Unix socket file or an IP address. The Unix datagram or UDP socket will be created using this parameter in order to read the external commands. Both IPv4 and IPv6 are supported. If the given path for Unix socket is not absolute, then it is created relative to run_dir (global parameter).

section.title: dgram_workers (str)
section.para: The number of worker processes to be created. Each worker process will be a datagram server.

section.title: dgram_mode (int)
section.para: Permission to be used for creating the listening UNIX datagram socket. Not necessary for a UDP socket. It follows the UNIX conventions.

section.title: dgram_group (int) dgram_group (str)
section.para: Group to be used for creating the listening UNIX socket.

para.emphasis: Default value is the inherited one.

section.title: dgram_user (int) dgram_group (str)
section.para: User to be used for creating the listening UNIX socket.

para.emphasis: Default value is the inherited one.

section.title: dgram_timeout (int)
section.para: The reply will expire after trying to sent it for socket_timeout miliseconds.

section.title: JSONRPC Commands
section.para: Here are some examples of RPC commands with the equivalent of running them with &kamcmd; and the corresponding JSON document for them. It is important to be aware that the name of the parameters doesn't matter, only the order of the values must be the one expected by &kamailio; RPC command.

example.title: JSONRPC Commands - Examples
example.programlisting:
... # kamcmd core.psx
{ "jsonrpc": "2.0", "method": "core.psx", "id": 1 } ... ## - prototype: kamcmd dispatcher.set_state _state_ _group_ _address_ # kamcmd dispatcher.set_state ip 2 sip:127.0.0.1:5080
{ "jsonrpc": "2.0", "method": "dispatcher.set_state", "params": ["ip", 2, "sip:127.0.0.1:5080"], "id": 1 }
## - or:
{ "jsonrpc": "2.0", "method": "dispatcher.set_state", "params": { "state": "ip", "grpup": 2, "address": "sip:127.0.0.1:5080" }, "id": 1 } ...

section.title: JSONRPC Transports
section.para: JSONRPC specifications do not enforce a specific transport to carry the JSON documents. Very common is JSONRPC over HTTP or HTTPS, and they are supported by &kamailio;. In addition, &kamailio; supports receiving JSON documents via a local FIFO file.

section.title: JSONRPC Over HTTP
section.para: It requires that XHTTP module is loaded. HTTPS can be used if you enable TLS for &kamailio;. The JSONRPC requests have to be sent to the TCP or TLS ports of &kamailio;.
The 'transport' parameter has to be 0 or 1.
The format of the JSON document must follow the JSONRPC specifications.

section.title: JSONRPC Over FIFO
section.para: This module can retrive JSONRPC requests via a local FIFO file. To enable this feature, 'fifo_name' parameter must be set and 'transport' parameter has to be 0 or 2.

The format of the JSON document must follow the JSONRPC specifications plus an additional field named 'reply_name'. The value for this field must be the name of the FIFO file were to write the JSONRPC response. The reply FIFO file is created in the folder specified by 'fifo_reply_dir'. section.title: JSONRPC Over DATAGRAM
section.para: This module can retrive JSONRPC requests via a UNIX socket file or UDP IPv4/IPv6 socket. To enable this feature, 'dgram_socket' parameter must be set and 'transport' parameter has to be 0 or 4.
The 'transport' parameter has to be 0 or 4.
The format of the JSON document must follow the JSONRPC specifications.
